title: Path of Exile 2 Early Access available today on PS5
description: Explore the dark, twisted realm of Wraeclast when Path of Exile 2 Early Access launches today on PS5. With extensive endgame systems, customizable skill and build progression, new Ascendancies, and more – there’s lots to explore and uncover. Players have six character classes, each of whom has been cast aside for various reasons.  A redefined […]
author: Jonathan Rogers

title: Ballionaire, the physics roguelike in which you build pachinko boards, drops on December 10th
description: There's no perfect time to release a video game, but if I were deciding when to release one, do you know when I'd do it? Alongside the largest blockbusters of the year, at a time when everyone is broke from buying presents, and on the same day as a huge awards show is distracting the industry's media. Ballionaire apparently shares my thinking. The pachinko-inspired roguelike is launching on December 10th. Read more
author: Graham Smith

title: Escape Simulator 2 announced with promises of Dracula's castle and an improved escape room editor
description: I had a few merry evenings playing Escape Simulator back in 2022. Of the co-op escape room games I've played, it was the best, both in terms of its relatively neutral framing (with little heavyhanded storytelling) and its pretty solid puzzle design. The game was expanded in the time since with a versus mode and several crossover DLC, and now there comes a sequel. Escape Simulator 2 will explore "darker escape room themes", looks visually more detailed, and comes with a new editor for those who wish to design their own escape rooms. Read more
author: Graham Smith

title: What happened to the humans in Flow? The director left hints
description: Gints Zilbalodis’ wordless animated movie Flow follows a little black kitty who’s navigating a flood in a post-apocalyptic, seemingly post-human world. The cat finds a boat, encounters a host of different animals, and slowly sails with them through the rising waters. It’s a tense adventure with absolutely stunning animal animation: The creature characters experience a […]

title: A Little Bit of MAC Club
description: I’m hesitant to say that I’ve got my makeup mojo back because I feel like the moment that I say that I’ll revert to just wearing brow pencil and tinted sunscreen for three years, as one does, but I’m gonna go ahead and risk it and say that it all started with a little bit of Club. You know, MAC Club eyeshadow? Of course you do. It’s a classic. Last week, out of nowhere, I thought to myself, “I really need to wear Club.” It’s been years since I’ve wanted to deal with complicated eye makeup, but I got the urge, so I went with it. My makeup collection is pretty barren compared to the thick of MBB’s beauty blogging days, but I’ve held on to this ancient Monster’s Bride palette from —I don’t even wanna say the year. LOL! I’ve always loved the shadows, especially Club. I took a little bit of Club, popped it on my lids and smoothed out the edges with a fluffy brush dipped in face powder. Oh, and this[Continue reading...] The post A Little Bit of MAC Club appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 859
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. A habit that changed your life? Getting up early. For most of my life I was a night owl, and when I had Connor that all changed. When she was an infant, I started waking up at the crack of dawn to sneak in work before she woke up in the morning. The habit ended up sticking, and now I’m an early bird. 2. Fruit or cupcakes? As much as I love a small cake smothered in frosting, I’m gonna have to go with fruit. 3. Are you doing any advent calendars this year? At Trader Joe’s a couple weeks ago, I picked up a few for the “kids” – Connor, Rosie and Marnie. Ha ha ha! 4. Something on your Christmas list? Honestly, I have no[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 859 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.

title: Walmart Has Two Super Mario Bros. Movie 4K Steelbooks In Stock For $28 Each
description: The Super Mario Bros. Movie Walmart-Exclusive Steelbook Edition (4K) $28 | Releases March 4 Preorder at Walmart The Super Mario Bros. Movie Power-Up Steelbook Edition (4K) $28 | Restocked at Walmart on Dec. 6 See at Walmart The Super Mario Bros. Movie is getting a new 4K Blu-ray release with a steelbook case on March 4, 2025. Exclusive to Walmart and available to preorder now for $28, The Super Mario Bros. Limited Edition Steelbook is likely to sell out fast. Walmart's exclusive steelbook releases of popular films often sell out well before launch, and we're talking about the biggest video game adaptation of all time here.In a bizarre plot twist, Walmart has also restocked the original steelbook release. You can purchase the Power-Up Edition's Collectible Steelbook version for $28, too. This edition has largely been sold out since prior to launch last June, but sporadic, briefly available restocks have popped up at major retailers over the past year.Now, the question you need to ask yourself is: Do you love Question Blocks (the new steelbook) or Super Mushrooms (the old steelbook) more? Or you could be like a-me and buy a-both.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Disney Gift Idea: Sorcerer Mickey Lego Diorama Gets First Big Discount
description: Magic of Disney Lego Set (1,103 Pieces) $80 (was $100) See at Target If you're in need of a gift for a Disney enthusiast, Target has a great deal on one of the newest display models for adults. The Magic of Disney is a 1,103-piece diorama bringing together characters and scenes from over 90 years of Disney animated films. Released in October and only available at Target and the Lego Store, The Magic of Disney is on sale for $80 (was $100). This deal is only available at Target.The Magic of Disney is the only Lego set still in production featuring a sizable Mickey Mouse character build that's meant for adult fans. Other Lego sets featuring Mickey are playsets designed for children. Magic of Disney is one of several Lego sets celebrating the history of Disney animation that's on sale now. You can also save big on the 1,540-piece Disney Villain Icons model, get an 8-pack of buildable characters for $36 (was $45), and piece together a picture frame with nine character panels for only $42 (was $60).Continue Reading at GameSpot
